overview: Actual video clips of dozens of games in action, from 1971′s “Computer Space” through the dawn of the NES era, accompanied by fascinating game-by-game historical notes. A detailed menu system lets you search year-by-year to jump directly to whichever game you want to see. It’s a “video book” and a celebration of the sights and sounds of video gaming’s history all in one.
tagline: The early history of video games
title: Phosphor Dot Fossils
